content.description: Left side of NW face has a ramp heading up and left.  This route and Left Dihedral both go up the ramp. But instead of going to the left-most dihedral, climb the one that is 6-8 feet to the right.
content.location: Left side of NW face has 2 shallow right-facing dihedrals.  This route is the right-hand of the 2.

content.description: Start at toe of upper crag and climb blocky arete that gradually steepens.  Tenuous crux starts in 3D area around bolt 8.
content.location: Right on the toe of the upper crag.  Gets very close to Joe's Right Side route near the top.

content.protection: Bolts but no real anchor yet.  Use your own draws for anchor and collect them off the top later.  Easy to do and temporary.
content.location: The NW face is divided by a large chimney/flake.  This route climbs the face to the left of the chimney.

content.description: On the left side of the NW face there is a ramp slanting up and left.  Both dihedral routes use this ramp to gain the dihedrals.  Get up on the ramp, follow it left to the left-most right-facing dihedral.  Layback up, then face climb to the anchor.
content.location: Left-most of the right-facing dihedrals on the left side of crag.

content.description: Burly moves through a roof/bulge lead to good face climbing above.
content.protection: Bolts.  Probably no real anchor yet.  But soon.  You can leave draws for anchor and retrieve them from top later.
content.location: NW face is split by big chimney/flake.  This route is right of that feature.

content.description: Sort of a blunt arete climb at first.  Then good face-climbing at top.  If you are shorter than 5'10" the crux may be 5.11a.
content.protection: Bolts.  Not sure about anchor right now.
content.location: Starts atop BIG boulder leaning against the right side of NW face.

content.description: Straight up face climbing with insecure feet at times.
content.location: On the left side of the NW face several routes start at about the same place.  This one goes straight up with no dihedrals or troughs nearby.

content.description:
5 minute approach and shade until 1:30. Good rock and easy access to top of crag for those that like TRs. You can get in a lot of cruxes in a short amount of time at this place.

 I have given most of the routes 2 stars, but they are not STRONG stars. 1.5 or 1.75 would be more like it. But the routes are fun and it is an efficient layout.
